page.title: 15A SAXON CHURCH IN GRIMSBY
page.content: {Holy Trinity and the Virgin Mary},Old Clee has a{Saxon tower}built of stone collected from the shore and built in{ {1050.}It is not listed in {Domesday.} We think the church had been destroyed in a{Viking raid}as it was made of wattle and daub.Only the tower remained.A new stone church was built by the{Normans}in 1192.A tablet on one of the Norman arches says that it was reopened by{Hugh,Bishop of Lincoln.} Stained glass altar windows show Hugh and King Richard as clues.The{Grant {Thorold's}of Weelsby Hall were local landowners.They gave money to{restore} the church in the{19th Century.}We found a{memorial}to them.Their {vault} is under the floor.It is called{'The {Brides Church'}because many want to marry there.A{past mayor}planted a new elm in the well-kept churchyard.there are no burials there now.
